sections.heading:
ONLINE VERSION OF UPDATED  
TEXT OF REPRINT
sections.content:
ONLINE VERSION OF UPDATED  
TEXT OF REPRINT

Latest  amendment  made  by 
P.U.  (B)  127/2005  which 
came into operation on

An Act relating to the changing of the titles of public offices, public 
bodies and Government Departments.

sections.heading: 1.   This Act may be cited as the Titles of Office Act 1949.
sections.content: 1.   This Act may be cited as the Titles of Office Act 1949.

sections.heading: 2.  In this Act, unless the context otherwise requires—
sections.content: 2.  In this Act, unless the context otherwise requires—

“public  office”  means  an  office  in  any  of  the  public  services 
mentioned in Clause (1) of Article 132 of the Federal Constitution and 
“federal public office” means an office in any of the public services

*NOTE—All references to “West Malaysia” shall be construed as reference to “Peninsular Malaysia”–see 
the Interpretation (Amendment) Act 1997 [Act A996], subsection 5(2).

mentioned in paragraphs (a) to (f), both inclusive, and in paragraph (h), 
of that Article.

3.  (1)  Wherever any title amongst those of the public offices set out 
in the first column of the First Schedule appears in any written law or 
in any notification made thereunder, it shall be deemed to be replaced 
by the corresponding title or titles set out in the second column of such 
Schedule.
In the application of this section to Sabah and Sarawak “written
law” means federal law, in force in those States, respectively.

4.   Whenever any change of title of any public office or of any public 
body or of any Department of any Government in Malaysia occurs, the 
Yang di-Pertuan Agong may, if occasion requires, by notification in 
the Gazette, make any necessary substitution in or addition to the First 
Schedule,  and  section  3  shall  apply  accordingly  in  conformity  with 
every such substitution or addition:

in the application of this section to Peninsular Malaysia, 
in the case of a public office, appointment to which does 
not involve liability to serve in more than one State, any 
such notification may be made only with the concurrence 
of the State Authority concerned; and

(b)   in  the  application  of  this  section  to  Sabah  and  Sarawak, 
any  such  notification  may  be  made  only  in  relation  to  a 
change of title of—

NOTE—All references to “West Malaysia” shall be construed as reference to “Peninsular Malaysia”–see 
the Interpretation (Amendment) Act 1997 [Act A996], subsection 5(2).
a Department of the Government of Malaysia.

5.   The Ordinances and Enactments set out in the Second Schedule are 
hereby amended or repealed to the extent specified in the third column 
of  the  said  Schedule,  but  without  prejudice  to  any  change  of  title 
effected by or under any such Ordinance or Enactment.
